text: Growler during RBWG. Pours a cloudy pink with small pinkish head. The aroma is oak and cherry skin. Medium body, sweet cherry, boozy, oak, good.

Sampled during RBWG Tampa 2015. Hazy reddish pour with a small head. Nose is fairly unique. Cherry cough medicine. Some strange botanicals. Sweet red fruits. Similar flavor. A touch papery and tired. Oily. Cherry fruit lozenges. Definitely boozy. Good under-the-bridge option.

Bottle shared during the RBWG 2015 Grand Tasting. Thanks to Danny Owl! Pours unclear pink-gold with minimal head. Light fruity notes in the nose, some old wood. Medium sweet flavor with a bit of alcohol, berries, pale bread. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with some sharp berry notes, tannin, wood. Good one.

Entering old notes- sampled with RBWG. Pours a hazy orange with a white head. Nose is cherry, booze, cough medicine, and some vanilla and sweetness. Flavor hits with all kinds of craziness: cherry, vanilla, citrus, booze, cough syrup, and some nightmare fuel. One for the history books for sure.

Bottle at RBWG 15 Grand Tasting @ Coppertail, thanks to Danny Toobah for this one, 21/02/15.
Murky crimson with moderate off white spotting.
Nose is woody, light vanilla, varnish, fruit notes.
Taste comprises light varnish, pink berry notes, straw, sweet and sour berry notes, wood.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Top end malt liquor for sure!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: rbwg2015. Courtesy of drowland, thanks Danny. It pours with a hazy peach to gold body that supports a thin near white head. The aroma offers up loads of oak and then heading into smooth cherry and mild tart tannin like odors. The taste has a nice modest cherry sensation thats blended with oak and earthy citrus fruit. This comes across pretty nice as the apple  honey  booze  pear sugary esters are off banging around in the background where there are three tubas just sitting there. What
Growler. Pours pink. Nose/taste of cherry, oak, sweet malt. Medium body. Smooth.
At RBWG, thanks Danny! Crazy beer.a year old malt liquor on cherry moonshine chips. Weird brown pink color. Cherry, oak, booze. Not terrible at all.

Poured a light pinkish color with aromas of cherries, booze, bread, and light oak. Flavors were bread and harsh alcohol with some light cherries and a smudge of oak. This growler was over a year old and by far not the worst beer I have had ever. Thanks Danny for the share.
Pours a murky pink. Aroma of cherries, malt and alcohol. Taste malty, alcohol and cherries.

Tasted during RBWG grand tasting. Thanks drowland. Hazy pinkish peach color. Minimal head, particles floating in the body. Medium to bigger body. Light carbonation, kind of slick. Nice oak, light fruity cherry moonshine flavor, mild bready malt. Moderate sweet, light bit of tart, more dry than the base beer. Interesting fun stuff.
Grower share from Owl at rbwg. Lots of oak, light fruity notes from the cherry. Mostly clear, orange-pink color. Tart cherry flavor, hint of oak, real nice even with the age.

hazy ruby red, white head. Very cherry forward, not getting much else but booze in this one. Kind of like drinking squirt w/ some grenadine added with a shot of liquor. Im not saying thats a bad thing, kool aid malted liquor, my brothers.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 on draft at Dr. Dannys going away party. again, sweeter than the base beer, but with a much stronger boozey nose. loads of fruit and some oakiness. best moonshine aged beer Ive had.
I can't even do a haiku for this... Just, just oak. So much oak. I hope the end comes soon.
7/13/13. On tap at Green Room. Thanks, guys! Hilarious hazy pink pour with a small khaki head. Light fruit, lots of oak and booze, and lingering caramel and corn. Thanks Billy and Eric!
